newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Goldtron unit in HK$60 mln China deal.
newsitem.headline: Goldtron unit in HK$60 mln China deal.

text.p: Goldtron Ltd said on Friday its Goldtron Holdings Ltd (GHL) unit had agreed to buy single purpose holding company China Showcase Ltd (CSL) for Hong Kong $60 million.
It said in a statement GHL would pay HK$13.75 million in cash from internal resources and bank borrowings and issue 92.5 million new ordinary shares to satisfy the balance of HK$46.25 million.
The new shares of HK$0.02 each would be issued at a price of HK$0.05 each.
The deal is subject to the approval of shareholders, the Stock Exchange of Hong Kong, due diligence investigations and various People's Republic of China authorities.

On completion of the agreement, GHL will contribute an aggregate amount of HK$77.5 million to subscribe for new ordinary shares in CSL and will own the entire issued ordinary share capital representing 69.2 percent of the total voting capital of CSL, it said.

On completion of the deal, Goldtron said its equity interest in GHL would be reduced to 48.3 percent from 73.6 percent, a dilution that takes into account the earlier disposal by Goldtron of 18.7 million shares in GHL.
Goldtron said GHL would cease to be a subsidiary.
The transaction is not expected to have any significant effect on the company or earnings in the financial year to December 31, 1997.
